intro: Gomphrena decumbens subvar. genuina, commonly known as the Mexican featherplant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its branched stems and clusters of small, papery bracts that resemble feathers, which are often brightly colored in shades of pink, red, and purple. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are surrounded by the showy bracts. Gomphrena decumbens subvar. genuina is a hardy perennial that is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
